meanings.definition: The absence of sound or noise.
meanings.sent1: In the library, the silence was so peaceful.
meanings.sent2: The silence of the night was broken by a distant owl hoot.
meanings.sent3: During the test, the silence was so loud you could hear a pin drop.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room was like a thick blanket, muffling all noise.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned house sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.sent1: Her silence on the matter spoke volumes.
meanings.sent2: His silence in the meeting made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The silence from the usually chatty toddler was a welcome break.
meanings.sent4: The silence of the witness in court raised suspicions.
meanings.sent5: The awkward silence between them was palpable.

meanings.definition: A period of time without any communication or noise.
meanings.sent1: After the argument, there was a tense silence in the room.
meanings.sent2: The long silence on the phone made her worry.
meanings.sent3: The silence between songs at the concert felt never-ending.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the car ride was filled with unspoken tension.
meanings.sent5: The silence of the desert at night was both eerie and beautiful.
